abstract: Gets the size of a user data item in an audio file.

declaration.code: func AudioFileGetUserDataSize64(_ inAudioFile: AudioFileID, _ inUserDataID: UInt32, _ inIndex: UInt32, _ outUserDataSize: UnsafeMutablePointer<UInt64>) -> OSStatus

overview:
## Return Value

A result code if there’s an error (see Result Codes) or `noErr` if the operation succeeds.

## Discussion

In this function, *user data* refers to:

Very large user data chunks, such as the Audio Definition Model (ADM) chunks that movie production uses, can exceed the 32-bit size limit or be prohibitively expensive to allocate large enough memory blocks to read them.

The BW64 format is 64-bit and based on WAVE. Parsing the ADM of a BW64 file with metadata becomes an iterative process that doesn’t require large memory buffers. In the following example, `ADMBuilder` is a type that uses the Builder pattern to parse an ADM document from sequentially provided segments:

items.description: Gets the number of user data items with a specified ID in a file.
items.name: AudioFileCountUserData(_:_:_:)

items.description: Gets the size of a user data item in an audio file.
items.name: AudioFileGetUserDataSize(_:_:_:_:)

items.description: Gets a chunk from an audio file.
items.name: AudioFileGetUserData(_:_:_:_:_:)

items.description: Gets part of the data from a chunk in an audio file.
items.name: AudioFileGetUserDataAtOffset(_:_:_:_:_:_:)

items.description: Sets a user data item in an audio file.
items.name: AudioFileSetUserData(_:_:_:_:_:)

items.description: Removes a user data item from an audio file.
items.name: AudioFileRemoveUserData(_:_:_:)
